primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human subject is engaged in a cosmic and existential struggle (the riddle of life) and must endure suffering without being defeated, eventually achieving victory through the possession of a 'treasure' (Jesus).

tekstueel_bewijs: You are out every day to find out what life is all about.
You and I will never understand... until we see it as a struggle.
We shall march on through floods and flames.
find out what this life is all about
the victory that overcometh the world

zender.identificatie: The Riddle of Life / God's Plan
tekstueel_bewijs: the riddle is put to us in the events of our existence
There is no place for defeat in God's plan.
put joy bells ringing in his heart
The difference between winning and losing in his life was Jesus Christ.
the love of Jesus which shed abroad bright sunshine in his spirit.
he had a friend who was very strong.

tegenstander.identificatie: Suffering, Sin, and the 'Cruel Sphinx' of Life
tekstueel_bewijs: the cruel Sphinx would devour a human soul
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as an inescapable, predatory force (the Sphinx) that threatens to devour the soul if the riddle of life is not solved.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The life of the Apostle Paul as a model for the primary program.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Paul
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Paul serves as the 'Exemplar' (Subject) whose success proves the Hearer can also succeed.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Jesus → The Christian ← The Riddle of Suffering

voorbeelden_god_subject: God which giveth us the victory
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You and I will never understand

voorbeelden: we must struggle day by day
trying to find out what this life is all about
Are you able to see a design?
He knew what it's all about.
the victory that overcometh the world

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on 'knowing' the nature of life (as struggle) and 'knowing' that Jesus is the solution to avoid being 'devoured' by the riddle.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (The Riddle/Suffering) through ~S1 (Struggling) to S1 (Victory).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Victory is achieved by the human subject 'enlisting' and 'carrying the treasure' of Jesus.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; suffering is described with visceral, anatomical detail.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it uses high Christological language, the actantial subject is consistently the human 'we' who must solve the riddle and use Jesus as a 'treasure' or 'friend' to achieve victory.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The difference between winning and losing in his life was Jesus Christ.
If you are not careful, it is a losing fight!

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Thanks be to God, which giveth us the victory

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul is presented as the ultimate 'University of Hard Knocks' graduate to be emulated.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how God sustained Paul despite Paul's weakness, rather than Paul's 'campaigning' for Jesus.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to endure and 'bounce back' like a rubber ball.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is framed as a heroic human endurance aided by a divine friend.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Sphinx legend to the life of Paul is rhetorically smooth but theologically creates a 'works-based' endurance narrative.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God gives victory' and 'We must enlist to win'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: In Jesus we shall triumph over every foe.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon substitutes 'the love of Jesus' for the specific work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is listed among 'sickness and sorrow' as a cause of suffering rather than a condition of death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon positions the hearer as the Subject of the struggle and Jesus as the Helper (Adjuvant). This risks turning grace into a tool for human resilience.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the one 'solving the riddle' and 'marching'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Jesus the Subject who solves the riddle and carries the hearer.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We shall march through floods,' use 'Christ carries us through the floods He already conquered.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'treasure' doing the work, not the vessel's ability to bounce.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on 2 Cor 4:7: 'that the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us.'

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already treats suffering with great seriousness.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'victory' feels like a reward for enlisting.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's victory) must precede and empower the Secondary Program (Our struggle).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful and empathetically deep, but it needs to shift the 'burden of victory' from the hearer to the Savior.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the Sphinx is a brilliant hook; actantially, it frames the gospel as a riddle-solving exercise for the human mind.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would note Paul's emphasis on 'death working in us'; the sermon focuses on 'not losing' (victory).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the 'Jesus' language, the 'engine' of the sermon is the human subject's quest for meaning.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Earthen Vessel' metaphor but focuses more on the vessel's endurance than its fragility.
